intro: Iris pallida subsp. pallida, commonly known as the pale iris, is a species native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, pale blue to lavender flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 3 feet. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance.
